top_procedures.description: Principal care management services for a single high-risk disease, first 30 minutes provided personally by qualified health care professional, per calendar month.
Established patient office or other outpatient, visit typically 25 minutes
Principal care management services for a single high-risk disease, first 30 minutes of clinical staff time directed by health care professional, per calendar month
Ultrasound examination of heart including color-depicted blood flow rate, direction, and valve function
Principal care management services for a single high-risk disease, each additional 30 minutes of clinical staff time directed by health care professional, per calendar month
Principal care management services for a single high-risk disease, each additional 30 minutes provided personally by qualified health care professional, per calendar month
Nuclear medicine study of vessels of heart using drugs or exercise multiple studies
Initial hospital inpatient care, typically 70 minutes per day
Subsequent hospital inpatient care, typically 35 minutes per day
New patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 45 minutes
Routine electrocardiogram (EKG) using at least 12 leads with interpretation and report
Subsequent hospital inpatient care, typically 25 minutes per day
Ultrasound examination and continuous monitoring of the heart performed during rest, exercise, and/or drug-induced stress with interpretation and report
Remote evaluations of single, dual, or multiple lead cardioverter-defibrillator with physician analysis, review, and report up to 90 days
Routine EKG using at least 12 leads including interpretation and report
Evaluation, testing, and programming adjustment of permanent multiple lead cardioverter-defibrillator including physician analysis, review, and report
Remote evaluations of single, dual, or multiple lead pacemaker or cardioverter-defibrillator transmissions, technician review, support, and distribution of results up to 90 days
Evaluation, testing, and programming adjustment of permanent dual lead cardioverter-defibrillator including physician analysis, review, and report
Annual wellness visit; includes a personalized prevention plan of service (pps), initial visit
Evaluation, testing, and programming adjustment of permanent dual lead pacemaker system with physician analysis, review, and report
